SENT.plain: Summary: We describe a 24-year-old woman who presented with twice previously unverified subarachnoid hemorrhages from the conus medullaris spinal arteriovenous malformation with Parkes-Weber-syndrome
Spinal MRI examination is considered to be necessary for the diagnosis of Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber syndrome
For diagnosis of the spinal cord arteriovenous malformation, it is indispensable to search carefully for the presence of accompanying lesions
Transarterial glue embolizationis effective for the management of the spinal vascular lesion
